SEARCH
Package gw.api.assignment

Interface DynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy

All Superinterfaces:
DynamicAssignmentStrategy
public interface DynamicGroupAssignmentStrategy extends DynamicAssignmentStrategy
A method for determining the assignment for an entity based on some customer-specified logic. This class uses the Strategy pattern to provide a way for customers to plug a specific algorithm into the assignment process in a way which deals with potential concurrency issues. For the most part, customers can simply implement assignment logic in Gosu. However, there are some algorithms (such as attempting to assign in a load-balanced way) which require the implementation to have the ability to lock entities, so that multiple assignments being performed on multiple machines will not conflict and/or cause unpredictable results. Since customer-written Gosu cannot access the entity-locking code directly, this strategy pattern, in conjunction with the Assignable.assignGroupDynamically() method, gives them a framework within which they can use their own logic to select the groups involved but let the core code deal with locking the required database rows.
Author:
bjohnson

  • Method Details

    • getCandidateGroups

      Set<Group> getCandidateGroups(Assignable assignable, Group group, boolean includeSubGroups)
      Return the set of groups who should be considered as the result of the assignment operation. This list should be as small as possible; it will be used to determine the set of database rows which must be locked, and the larger the set, the greater the potential impact of performance as multiple machines wait to acquire the locks.
      Parameters:
      assignable - The entity to be assigned
      group - The group to be used to generate the list of groups; usually the currently assigned group, may be null
      includeSubGroups - Whether all subgroups of the specified group should be considered, or only the supplied group
      Returns:
      The set of groups who may get the assignment

    • getLocksForAssignable

      Set<KeyableBean> getLocksForAssignable(Assignable assignable, Set<Group> candidateGroups)
      Return the set of entities which should be locked while the assignment is performed, based on the supplied set of candidate groups. The dynamic assignment framework will then lock each of these entities before calling findGroupToAssign(). The set returned should be as small as possible, to minimize performance impact as machines wait to acquire the locks.
      Parameters:
      assignable - The entity to be assigned
      candidateGroups - The set of candidate groups returned by the call to getCandidateGroups()
      Returns:
      The set of entities which should be locked while the actual assignment selection process is performed.

    • findGroupToAssign

      Group findGroupToAssign(Assignable assignable, Set<Group> candidateGroups, Set<? extends KeyableBean> locks)
      Pick a group to be assigned out of the supplied set of groups. Usually at least one of the lock entities will be updated as part of the selection process (as when a load-balancing metric is incremented, for example). Once this method returns, the locked entities will be committed and unlocked, to minimize the bottlenecks for concurrent assignments. This means that the changes to the lock entities will be persisted before the assignment itself; there is code in the dynamic assignment framework to be as resilient as possible in the face of validation and other issues and ensure that the assignment does not get lost if it can be prevented. However, it should be understood that any metrics updated by this method may, over time, diverge from reality. There should be a mechanism in place to periodically re-sync things to ensure proper behavior
      Parameters:
      assignable - The entity to be assigned
      candidateGroups - The set of candidate groups returned by the call to getCandidateGroups()
      locks - The set of lockable entities returned by the call to getLocksForAssignable()
      Returns:
      The selected Group to which the entity will be assigned.
